attachments.fallback:
<@U0177S413PC>: Hi, I'd like to ask a question! Please check the details.
*Question title:* `New Tech SKUs to Add`
*Topic:* `Adding a new feature/capability`
*Details:* `We are looking to add a few more tech SKUs to expand our calorie range to allow more customers to be able to sign up. Here are the new tech SKUs to add: KN-TDR-1-60-0, KN-DR-1-60-0, KN-DRC1-1-60-0, KN-TDR-1-2250-0, KN-DR-1-2250-0, KN-DRC1-1-2250-0, KN-TFR-1-2250-0, KN-FR-1-2250-0, KN-FRC1-1-2250-0, KN-TMX-1-2250-0, KN-MX-1-2250-0, KN-MXC1-1-2250-0 plans. This will also expand our range of calories a customer can sign up with from 54 to 2475. 

Please share requirements for launch and timeline. Ideally we can launch this by W52. `

*Category:* squad-nv-pet-food
*Command:* pet-food-question
attachments.text:
<@U0177S413PC>: Hi, I'd like to ask a question! Please check the details.
*Question title:* `New Tech SKUs to Add`
*Topic:* `Adding a new feature/capability`
*Details:* `We are looking to add a few more tech SKUs to expand our calorie range to allow more customers to be able to sign up. Here are the new tech SKUs to add: KN-TDR-1-60-0, KN-DR-1-60-0, KN-DRC1-1-60-0, KN-TDR-1-2250-0, KN-DR-1-2250-0, KN-DRC1-1-2250-0, KN-TFR-1-2250-0, KN-FR-1-2250-0, KN-FRC1-1-2250-0, KN-TMX-1-2250-0, KN-MX-1-2250-0, KN-MXC1-1-2250-0 plans. This will also expand our range of calories a customer can sign up with from 54 to 2475. 

Please share requirements for launch and timeline. Ideally we can launch this by W52. `

*Category:* squad-nv-pet-food
*Command:* pet-food-question

_thread_replies.text:
:sparkles: *Automatic Answer:* 
To add the new tech SKUs and expand the calorie range, follow these steps:

1. Use the CCM (Customer Care Management) tool to add the new SKUs:
   - Access <https://operations.hellofresh.com/ccm/products>
   - Ensure you have write permissions for SKUs

2. If you don't have write permissions:
   - Request access to <https://operations.hellofresh.com/ccm/skus>
   - Alternatively, ask for a write token from someone with the necessary permissions

3. Use the products service API to add the new SKUs:
   - Utilize the CCM edit token for authentication
   - Call the seeder API endpoint of the products-service

4. Update any relevant discount settings:
   - If no specific discount is set for new SKUs, the default value for the box rule will apply
   - To set specific discounts, manually edit each active discount setting

5. Verify the new calorie range (54 to 2475) is correctly reflected in the system

6. Test the new SKUs to ensure they are properly integrated and available for customer sign-up

7. Coordinate with relevant teams (e.g., Customer Care, Marketing) to prepare for the launch

To meet the W52 launch timeline, start the process as soon as possible and set internal deadlines for each step.

For more details on product management, please visit <https://operations.hellofresh.com/ccm/products|here>
 *Additional sources:*
<https://hellofresh.slack.com/archives/CQQNMEPK2/p1681309497608599?thread_ts=1681309497.608599&utm_source=slack-commander|[Q&A] DO vouchers have specific SKUs they can be applied to?>
<https://hellofresh.slack.com/archives/C049H9UE22X/p1751359298034509?thread_ts=1751359298.034509&utm_source=slack-commander|[Q&A] Incorrect add-on selection added to slot after removing original add-on> :warning:_This answer was generated based on the available documentation mentioned above, proceed with caution._

Does this resolve your query, <@U0177S413PC>? Unified Search :mag: button

text.text:
:sparkles: *Automatic Answer:* 
To add the new tech SKUs and expand the calorie range, follow these steps:

1. Use the CCM (Customer Care Management) tool to add the new SKUs:
   - Access <https://operations.hellofresh.com/ccm/products>
   - Ensure you have write permissions for SKUs

2. If you don't have write permissions:
   - Request access to <https://operations.hellofresh.com/ccm/skus>
   - Alternatively, ask for a write token from someone with the necessary permissions

3. Use the products service API to add the new SKUs:
   - Utilize the CCM edit token for authentication
   - Call the seeder API endpoint of the products-service

4. Update any relevant discount settings:
   - If no specific discount is set for new SKUs, the default value for the box rule will apply
   - To set specific discounts, manually edit each active discount setting

5. Verify the new calorie range (54 to 2475) is correctly reflected in the system

6. Test the new SKUs to ensure they are properly integrated and available for customer sign-up

7. Coordinate with relevant teams (e.g., Customer Care, Marketing) to prepare for the launch

To meet the W52 launch timeline, start the process as soon as possible and set internal deadlines for each step.

For more details on product management, please visit <https://operations.hellofresh.com/ccm/products|here>

*Additional sources:*
<https://hellofresh.slack.com/archives/CQQNMEPK2/p1681309497608599?thread_ts=1681309497.608599&utm_source=slack-commander|[Q&A] DO vouchers have specific SKUs they can be applied to?>

Hi <@U01U67XD681> & all. I've created this tab in the pricing model with all the prices & cadences for the new SKUs. <https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/1kvptwKYox5VQdxqFq2Rq451KvCVYfRnhDnoLhCME9_M/edit?gid=1988913418#gid=1988913418|Link here>.

A few things to note:
â€¢ It includes the default SKU & cadence for the regular box in column F
â€¢ These are the prices to use before our price drop. I have also created other new test prices for our price drop but that comes after so I haven't included them in here
â€¢ We've decided to only include 1 regular box cadence for the 60 cal air dried SKU i.e. there's no KN-DRC1-1-60-0 -> please let us know if that's an issue <@U8F7ZDAPM> <@U01U67XD681> 
Shout if you have any qus :slightly_smiling_face:

elements.text: Hi
& all. I've created this tab in the pricing model with all the prices & cadences for the new SKUs.
Link here

.

A few things to note:
It includes the default SKU & cadence for the regular box in column F
These are the prices to use before our price drop. I have also created other new test prices for our price drop but that comes after so I haven't included them in here
We've decided to only include 1 regular box cadence for the 60 cal air dried SKU i.e. there's no KN-DRC1-1-60-0 -> please let us know if that's an issue
Shout if you have any qus

_thread_replies.text: Hi all, thanks for sharing the prices. <@UFC7CRXMZ> just wanted to share a heads-up that the lack of VC SKU for the 60kcal plan will require extra effort to prepare existing features (e.g., Adjust Portion Size or change plans). We will share the effort and impact in the first effort estimation as soon as we have it scoped.

elements.text: Hi all, thanks for sharing the prices.

just wanted to share a heads-up that the lack of VC SKU for the 60kcal plan will require extra effort to prepare existing features (e.g., Adjust Portion Size or change plans). We will share the effort and impact in the first effort estimation as soon as we have it scoped.

<@U0139TY5FDF>: Hi, I want to report a new issue. Please check the details.
*Issue:* `Check for valid delivery days`
*Topic:* `OC and SCM export`
*Priority:* `Medium priority ðŸŸ¡`
*Description:* `Can we check if holiday shifts are working for next week? E.g. noone has a Thursday 11/27 or Friday 11/28 delivery? These were done via HMT shift. I also had to make LC changes that will be in place for the next 6 weeks and some of those didn't register (e.g customers werent moved to a different day) so I just want to make sure the HMT shift did work (even though it's a different process)`
*Expected behaviour:* `No customers with Thurs 11/27 or Fri 11/28 delivery`
*Actual behaviour:* `Need to check! there were customers this week with invalid Tuesday / Friday deliveries due to recent LC changes (not HMT shifts so slightly different but want to be safe)`

*Category:* squad-nv-pet-food
*Command:* pet-food-issue

_thread_replies.text:
I think Claudia is correct here, looking at the user's history i see that:
1. At some point they changed their delivery address to something that is viable for frozen add-ons (80435)
2. The subscribed to *`Fresh Plan Variety Box`*
3. They changed their address again to something incompatible (75002)
But at that point user is already subscribed to the add-on
